column17: The incident occurred in the Libreville district.
column18: 06/14/2017: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at a Coalition for the New Republic (CNR) party headquarters in Libreville, Estuaire, Gabon. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column97: Two Molotov cocktails were used in the attack.
column108: A building was damaged in this attack.

column131: Gabon. The assailants forced station employees to broadcast a recorded message and planted an explosive device in the office. There were no reported casualties
column132: and the explosive device was later defused at the scene. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Libreville on this date. Roland Desire Aba'a Minko
column133: a supporter of opposition leader Jean Ping
column134: claimed responsibility for the incidents and demanded that President Ali Bongo Ondimba resign from office."
column180: Roland Desire Aba'a Minko, a supporter of opposition leader Jean Ping, claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that the Gabonese president step down.
column213: An explosive device, machetes, and clubs were used in the attack.
